verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329>, A Psalm<WH4210> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah<WH7141>. LORD<WH3068>, thou hast been favourable<WH7521> unto thy land<WH776>: thou hast brought back<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622><WH7622> of Jacob<WH3290>.
Thou hast forgiven<WH5375> the iniquity<WH5771> of thy people<WH5971>, thou hast covered<WH3680> all their sin<WH2403>. Selah<WH5542>.
Thou hast taken away<WH622> all thy wrath<WH5678>: thou hast turned<WH7725> thyself from the fierceness<WH2740> of thine anger<WH639>.
Turn<WH7725> us, O God<WH430> of our salvation<WH3468>, and cause thine anger<WH3708> toward us to cease<WH6565>.
Wilt thou be angry<WH599> with us for ever<WH5769>? wilt thou draw out<WH4900> thine anger<WH639> to all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>?
Wilt thou not revive<WH2421> us again<WH7725>: that thy people<WH5971> may rejoice<WH8055> in thee?
Shew<WH7200> us thy mercy<WH2617>, O LORD<WH3068>, and grant<WH5414> us thy salvation<WH3468>.

I will hear<WH8085> what God<WH410> the LORD<WH3068> will speak<WH1696>: for he will speak<WH1696> peace<WH7965> unto his people<WH5971>, and to his saints<WH2623>: but let them not turn again<WH7725> to folly<WH3690>.
Surely his salvation<WH3468> is nigh<WH7138> them that fear<WH3373> him; that glory<WH3519> may dwell<WH7931> in our land<WH776>.
Mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> are met together<WH6298>; righteousness<WH6664> and peace<WH7965> have kissed<WH5401> each other.
Truth<WH571> shall spring out<WH6779> of the earth<WH776>; and righteousness<WH6664> shall look down<WH8259> from heaven<WH8064>.
Yea, the LORD<WH3068> shall give<WH5414> that which is good<WH2896>; and our land<WH776> shall yield<WH5414> her increase<WH2981>.
Righteousness<WH6664> shall go<WH1980> before<WH6440> him; and shall set<WH7760> us in the way<WH1870> of his steps<WH6471>.
